Description: One ear-ring and four beads made in different shapes. A: One fragment of a penannular ear-ring made of a white stone with grey inclusions, semi-circular in section. One finished end preserved, the rest broken off. The outer surface is well polished, the inside shows marks from the drill. B: Two segmented cylindrical beads, maximum seven segments preserved, made of white faience. C: One ring-shaped bead made of white faience. D: One disc-shaped bead made of white faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
